result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D. Rygula

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 1:25 PM/ RM 301, 22CF175 & 20CF10. Court notes case no 22TR562 is cross referenced to 22CF175. Defendant Michael D. Rygula in court.  Attorney Brian Christopher Williams in court for Michael D. Rygula.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history's. 20CF10 to track along with 22CF175. On 22TR562, a Hearing for Payment is scheduled for December. Atty Williams has received a copy of the criminal complaints, waives reading, enters plea of not guilty on 22CF175, requests time limits for PH be waived and requests pre trial conference prior to P.H. scheduled. Def. is in agreeance and waives time limits on P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 035580,
Payable Number: 67175,
Receipt Number: 22R 003923,
Amount: $20.00

3:12 PM Defendant Michael D. Rygula in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has Atty., Brian C. Williams. State makes remarks regarding Def. other case. Court notes no notice of retainer filed. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

1:06 PM Defendant Michael D. Rygula appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. has Court repeat charges. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own or court appointed Atty or represent self. Def. does wish to attain counsel. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State gives bond recommendations and requests $2,000.00 cash bond with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Court questions previous bond. State responds. Def. makes bond remarks and has no objection. Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond with cond. Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
